name: Shiroko's Math Funhouse
description:
Intro

Shiroko's Math Funhouse is a game where you can learn the basics of arithmetics with the help of a very adorable girl named, as you guessed, Shiroko. You are going to be taught addition, subtraction, as well as 

t͙̲͚̹͈ͅr͎̱ͅị̜pĺ͙͍̙̼ͅę̣͚̳͚͍ͅ ͏̳͔͍i̳̯̤͓͓̳̟nt̥͇͙͙̗̯͜e̮͉g̪r̺͇͠a͟t̞͍̣̟͖͝i͎̳͇͇o̪̯͕n̲͇̗̤ ͉̟̗̳͓̩ͅa̖̰̣͍͚͠ṇ̭͉̙ḓ̡̭͇̗ ̸s͍̖͇͈͕̬̜͢i͏̝͕̠͓x̠̜̣̦͚̳͍t̮̠̘̲̭͓̣h̻̗͝ o͢r̗͇͖͎̺̲d̷̖ęr̙̻̗̙̝͔ ͖͟p̸̘o͇͈̠l͎̪͕͡y̫̼͉̰̼ńo͔͘m̖̭̣͓s̸̯͚! I swear this is not survival horror! But you should not anger Shiroko too much by being way too correct, no matter at what cost.

OwO what's this game?

ok so first off don't owo me :( It's a game inspired by many things. Firstly, the kind of game you'd play when you were young to learn how to math. Personally it was more of a "fill a cup of water from a tap" game and it was so old I'm amazed I still remember it, as well as some edutainment game with a duck.

It is also inspired from mystman12's game Baldi's Basics in Education and Learning, as well as the well-famed Impossible Quiz by Splapp-me-Do (it's the wiki page though).

This game is for Windows and Mac only, there plans to make it available for Linux in the future.

Older versions can be found here (versions 0.2 to 0.18 in a single zip file)

Controls

Just Answer With The Correct Number And Press Enter

Contact

Got a glitch? A suggestion of what kind of insanity I should add in the game? Give me a yell at @Gezoch on Twitter!
